page.title: 04THE HISTORY OF PASTON
page.content: At the time of the first Domesday survey, Paston did not exist as an area worthy of mention. A church has been present since about 800 A.D. The present church dating from 1217.Paston at the beginning of the century was a small hamlet of around 30 houses, many of the inhabitants connected either with the church or with farming.The only buildings remaining of any age in 1985 are the old rectory and Paston Farm which is now used as a Youth and Play Centre.A branch of the M. and G. N. railway ran through Paston calling at the brickworks at Dogsthorpe and Eye Green.It closed many years ago now.Paston was chosen as a development area by the Peterborough Development Corporation.Paston School was built in 1969. In 1972 the development of housing estates began with a new school,shops and health centre.
